entry.title: Ruben Vardanyan shares emotional message from Azerbaijani jail

media:group.media:title: Ruben Vardanyan shares emotional message from Azerbaijani jail
media:group.media:description:
üìç In an emotional audio message to his family from isolation in a Baku prison, former Artsakh cabinet leader Ruben Vardanyan said he is ‚Äúready to bear the most severe punishment if only it would help bring peace and stability.‚Äù üìç Russia does not expect Armenia to be automatically expelled from the Collective Security Treaty Organization (CSTO) if it fails to pay its membership fees by the end of 2025, Deputy Foreign Minister Alexander Pankin said. üìç Burying responsibility for the fall of Artsakh: https://youtu.be/hMmQpaQ_89E?si=tqDC2p-Qji5qLaCE

entry.title: International law and Armenian prisoners in Baku

media:group.media:title: International law and Armenian prisoners in Baku
media:group.media:description:
Dr. Gurgen Petrossian, lecturer at Friedrich-Alexander-University and chairman of the German-Armenian Lawyers‚Äô Association, talks to CivilNet about the uncertain future of Armenia's cases at international courts, at a time when Armenian prisoners are suffering in Baku. He says the torture and dehumanization currently being inflicted upon them by the Azerbaijani state as they undergo sham trials is a form of psychological warfare directed against all Armenians. He suggests actions for the Armenian government and other nations to address this atrocity, and to strengthen the system of international justice at a time when it has come under unprecedented attacks.
#CivilNet #’ç’´’æ’´’¨’Ü’•’©

entry.title: Armenia‚Äôs top legal representative steps down amid uncertainty over lawsuits

media:group.media:title: Armenia‚Äôs top legal representative steps down amid uncertainty over lawsuits
media:group.media:description:
üìç Yeghishe Kirakosyan, Armenia‚Äôs international legal representative, is stepping down from his position in mutual agreement with the government. üìç Armenia will appoint a defense attach√© to its representation to the European Union in Brussels. The move is meant to deepen ties, as the EU proposes a second round of non-lethal military aid. üìç Journalism caught between ethics and Azerbaijani influence- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BHC1sjTQSso

entry.title: Burying responsibility for the fall of Artsakh

media:group.media:title: Burying responsibility for the fall of Artsakh
media:group.media:description:
In this episode of Insights, host Eric Hacopian delves into the complex issues surrounding Armenia's proposed constitutional reforms, unpacking the underlying motives and potential implications. He critically examines Prime Minister Pashinyan's "Real Armenia" concept, exposing how the attempts to reframe the narrative around Artsakh and state-building contradict Armenia's interests. Hacopian then analyzes the broader context of the constitutional debate, highlighting how Azerbaijan's demands and the government's political calculations are shaping the reform process.
#CivilNet #’ç’´’æ’´’¨’Ü’•’© #insightswitherichacopian

entry.title: Bless√©s de guerres du Karabakh, soigner ces esprits tourment√©s

media:group.media:title: Bless√©s de guerres du Karabakh, soigner ces esprits tourment√©s
media:group.media:description:
Deux √† trois fois par an, la psychologue clinicienne et psychanalyste Anahit Dasseux Ter-Mesropian se rend en Arm√©nie pour travailler avec les psychologues locaux. Anahit et d‚Äôautres coll√®gues de France, Belgique ou encore de Suisse ont √©t√© t√©moins des ravages psychologiques de la guerre sur les soldats arm√©niens. La guerre du Haut-Karabakh de 2020 a laiss√© des s√©quelles.Chaque ann√©e, ces sp√©cialistes b√©n√©voles reviennent pour apporter leur expertise aupr√®s de psychologues arm√©niens locaux qui √©taient, au d√©but, d√©munis face √† tant de traumatismes. C‚Äôest via l‚Äôassociation Sant√© Arm√©nie que psys d'Arm√©nie et d‚Äôailleurs travaillent ensemble pour aider ceux qui ont vu l‚Äôhorreur √† se reconstruire.

entry.title: Baku expels Red Cross, isolating Armenian prisoners

media:group.media:title: Baku expels Red Cross, isolating Armenian prisoners
media:group.media:description:
üìç Azerbaijan notified the International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) today that it must close its delegation in the country. üìç The European Union has announced a new proposal for non-lethal assistance to Armenia through the European Peace Facility (EPF). üìç The Trump-Zelensky showdown and what it means for Armenia: https://youtu.be/Ia3Ie-J5T58?si=CRPUmUHew8-m2qXa
